result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trashawn Vokiah Armistead

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Trashawn Vokiah Armistead not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Trashawn Vokiah Armistead.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests time to file a motion.  Court set a status date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Trashawn Vokiah Armistead not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Trashawn Vokiah Armistead.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Trashawn Vokiah Armistead not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Trashawn Vokiah Armistead in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton; both appear by video.  Defendant Trashawn Vokiah Armistead in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Milwaukee School of the Arts & Larry F.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Trashawn Vokiah Armistead in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Trashawn Vokiah Armistead in custody.  Sarah Mackenzie Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
